data.question: What is the title of the article?
data.answer: Urea Metal–Organic Frameworks as Effective and Size-Selective Hydrogen-Bond Catalysts

data.question: Who are the corresponding authors of the study?
data.answer: Omar K. Farha, Joseph T. Hupp, and Karl A. Scheidt

data.question: What is the main objective of synthesizing the new urea-containing metal–organic framework (MOF)?
data.answer: To act as a heterogeneous catalyst for hydrogen-bond-donor catalysis

data.question: What is the formula of the synthesized MOF designated as NU-601?
True or False: NU-601 showed higher catalytic activity compared to diphenylurea for the Friedel–Crafts reaction.
What method was used to confirm the removal of DMF from NU-601?
What was the main challenge addressed by incorporating urea into the MOF structure?
data.answer: To prevent self-quenching behavior due to catalyst–catalyst interactions

data.question: True or False: NU-601 is not reusable as a catalyst.
What was the yield percentage of 1-methyl-2-(1-nitropropan-2-yl)-1H-pyrrole (7) using NU-601 as a catalyst?
True or False: The catalysis with NU-601 occurs primarily on its exterior surface.
What was the main solvent used for the exchange process to activate NU-601?
True or False: The size of substrates does not affect the catalytic activity of NU-601.
What technique was used to determine the structure of NU-601?
How was the percentage by weight of strut 1 in NU-601 determined?
True or False: NU-601's catalytic activity decreases significantly after five cycles of use.
What was the main reaction tested to evaluate the catalytic performance of NU-601?
data.answer: Friedel–Crafts reactions between pyrroles and nitroalkenes

data.question: True or False: NU-601 was synthesized under solvothermal conditions.
What was the main reason for using MeNO2 for solvent exchange in NU-601?
data.answer: To remove the residual hydrogen-bonded DMF and activate the N–H urea sites

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of NU-601 involves the use of a symmetrical urea tetracarboxylate strut.
What property of NU-601 allows it to be an effective size-selective catalyst?
data.answer: Its large channels and the spatial arrangement of N–H urea bonds projecting into the pores
